p.s: In the article Is the usefulness of unions in the protection of workers rights coming to an end? The answer is yes which was published on the 24. November 2011 by Brian Pollard in The Gulf News, there is a question brought up and answered.
To do this, the autorauthor used many stylistic devices, which ImI'm going to analyse in the following.
Pollard's point of view is already present to the reader, by just reading the headline.
By asking a question and then answering it in the next sentence he leaves the reader no other option than starting in the text with this questionequestion in the back of theretheir mind.
He also makes use of enumerations like in line 7-8 good working conditions, good wages and save working environment to present the reader how little the unions are needed.
All these things the unions protected the workers from are now regulated by legislation, laws and our moral values.
Pollard also uses a repetition workers are not being exploited by employers, now employers are being exploited by employees (ll. 18, 19).
The repetition is used to keep this phrase present to the reader, even if he is finished with the Texttext.
There is another example of the use of stylistic devices; the economic mess the world is today.
A use of methaforicalmetaphorical language witchwhich leads to the conclusion, that the world is in critical economical situation witchwhich is influleldinfluenced by many factors.
Even though I think that he has got a point, he is overall wrong.
There are a lot of non-european countryscountries which are still ruled by the big companies werewhere unions are more important than ever.
